DataElement.preferredName: Endoscopic Biopsy Diagnostic Procedure Esophageal Carcinoma Assessment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was diagnostic assessment or evalution to diagnose a malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa using endoscopic biopsy, the removal of tissue specimens or fluid using an endoscope for microscopic examination.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Endoscopic Biopsy Diagnostic Procedure Esophageal Carcinoma Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnostic assessment or evaluation to diagnose a malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa using endoscopic biopsy, the removal of tissue specimens or fluid using an endoscope for microscopic examination.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis. In the case of an endoscopic biopsy, an endoscope is used to obtain the sample.:Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis. In the case of an endoscopic biopsy, an endoscope is used to obtain the sample.
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa.  Two major histologic types of esophageal carcinoma have been described: squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma.  This type of cancer is associated with excessive ethanol and cigarette usage.  --2002:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa. Two major histologic types of esophageal carcinoma have been described: squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma. This type of cancer is associated with excessive ethanol and cigarette usage.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
